formalText: Suggested to her that she may be thinking about suicide in a way as a release from the frustration and feeling bad that has been going on because of not finding a job.
She is in a difficult situation where it's hard to be in touch with herself and hurt at the same time.
Started out by saying, "I'm feeling pretty proud of myself right now.
I woke up this morning and I was really not doing well.
I was wanting to hurt myself and was doing really bad.
I kind of sat there and thought well, my therapist would probably say that this was something about feeling this way sucks .
So it was a kind of comfort for me.
I can say kind of this isn't really my fault.
I thought okay, and then I felt better" .
She is frustrated because she basically has a month of waiting because she has applied to all of the positions.
She said, "So now I basically have to sit for the next month and see if anybody calls me.
So that's going to be hard".
She said, "I's like the last couple of days it kept getting worse and worse.
I also kept feeling like I just needed something to snap me out of it and I wasn't able to find that.
She is worried about sitting around and being anxious.
She applied for basically all of the positions that she would be a good fit for.
She has pretty much the same conversation with James once a week where she is so anxious thinking she should just drop the entire thing.
She states, "I feel like my depression and anxiety just makes me a worse person consistently."

She has been thinking of her suffering in terms of what the church says about it.She told her sister what was going on and that she was having a bad day and that she was anxious about finding a job and haven't heard back from anywhere, but her sister was having a good day and she felt bad burdening her.
She states that she really likes going to church in some ways.
but the idea of church is difficult for her to
deal with even when she is not depressed.
James and her have constant conversations.
Her sister works at church.
